sub_title: Quantitative Analyst | MSc Mathematical Finance | Stochastic Calculus | Derivatives Modelling and Pricing | c++ & Python | Numerical Methods
summary:
I am a passionate mathematical finance graduate whose interest in finance began rather unfortunately by losing money in a Ponzi scheme (after high school). Since then I have acquired a BSc in Financial Mathematics and an MSc in Mathematical Finance. I have a theoretical understanding of stochastic calculus, derivatives pricing in discrete and continuous time, c++, python and computational methods. I am excited to leverage my skills in an entry-level position as a quantitative analyst (& financial engineering). My previous experience includes a 1-year actuarial assistant position at Hollard Insurance Botswana.

In my spare time, I write articles for my blog (http://themodelscollector.co.uk), exploring some of my own ideas in mathematical finance. So, if you are interested in learning about my professional journey or have a peculiar taste and want to discuss why a stock and bond portfolio with a strictly positive initial value and a positive value after 1 time step is an arbitrage opportunity, please connect with me 😉.

profile_positions.description:
• Analysed the monthly distribution of COVID-19 deaths and claims, then prepared a monthly report to be shared with management. This process involved collecting data from the claims department, identifying and correcting errors, then using various time series plots to analyse trend, seasonality and correlation.
• Analysed the quarterly profitability of various life insurance products by calculating the claims-to-premium ratio, then writing a report to be used by the product development team in assessing and repricing certain life insurance products.  
• Lead person in pricing and quoting for group life insurance products in the actuarial team. This involved receiving and checking membership data for possible errors, running the data through a quoting tool, and adjusting monthly premiums per our risk management requirements.
profile_positions.title: Actuarial Assistant

company.name: Heriot Watt Trading and Investment Club

profile_positions.company: Heriot Watt Trading and Investment Club
profile_positions.description:
• Worked in the equity research team to analyse the performance of equities (U.S, UK and Emerging Markets), commodities and currencies. 
• We employed a top-down approach; this involved assessing the status of the global economy, then selecting regions, sectors and stocks that were most likely to outperform the market in the short term (5-10 years).
• Developed and implemented a risk strategy in Microsoft Excel that calculated the Value at Risk (VaR) of a selected portfolio of stocks and various indices in a 5-year term. This tool enabled the equity research team to pick stocks with a lower risk profile.
profile_positions.title: Equity Research Analyst

profile_positions.description:
• Worked in a team responsible for the management of jobs migrations from receptor to donor locations in the EMEA (Europe, Middle East and Africa) region.
• Liaised with the donor and receptor teams to build a profile of the job/position the company intends to migrate. Built a migration schedule in Microsoft Excel to aid in assigning tasks and keeping track of the entire migration schedule. 
• Engaged legal, tax and compliance entities to ensure that the proposed job migration complies with local regulations and reported any issues to relevant internal entities.
• Conducted meetings and was the primary point of communication between the project management team and various internal entities involved in the migration process.
profile_positions.title: Securities Processing
